Articles.Content: Quite good article giving you a sense just how dark 67P is: http://blogs.esa.int/rosetta/2014/10/17/navcams-shades-of-grey/

Quite good article giving you a sense just how dark 67P is: http://blogs.esa.int/rosetta/2014/10/17/navcams-shades-of-grey/

Ignoring the fact they've used a false color image of Enceladus, we can't really tell by looking at this photo how the comet would appear to our eyes. Even they said it's not a linear connection between actual luminosity and our vision. It heavily depends on the distance and it's complicated.

Looking at this photo I can say that Enceladus, placed away from Earth so that it looks the same size as the Moon, would be a bit painful to watch. You couldn't distinguish any surface features, it would be like a spotlight.

67P/C-G, in the same conditions, would be a bit dimmer than the Moon.

For all folks that are citizens of an ESA member nation, there is a naming contest for the landing site.

http://www.esa.int/Our_Activities/Space_Science/Rosetta/Name_Rosetta_mission_s_landing_site_competition_rules

Landing on a Comet- The trailer.

Somehow the music in that trailer reminds me of the music in the trailer for Prometheus... I wonder if it was intentional? I bet they had fun making it.

Somehow the music in that trailer reminds me of the music in the trailer for Prometheus... I wonder if it was intentional? I bet they had fun making it.

I think they are trying to compete with the Seven Minutes of Terror video.....Seven Hours of Anxious Waiting.

Hi guys

I'm posting from the bus home

so I apologize for the brevity and lack of grammar. I just had a presentation where the NASA project manager for the mission explained what is currently happening with Rosetta.

As of yesterday the landing site was selected and they will attempt the landing on November 12th!

I also got a sweet selfie with Claudia which I'll upload when I get home... I talked with her about the mission and I might get to do research with her this upcoming summer at jpl!! I'm super excited and had to tell someone!

Unfortunately she didn't know about ksp but I can happily say she does now:D
That is an amazing opportunity! What kind of research at JPL? Do you work there or is it some sort of internship program?

So today someone created this image, a T-Rex to scale with the comet:

Then it seems a Kerbal fan responded:

Ha that's pretty funny.

I made one earlier with a football field to scale:

That is an amazing opportunity! What kind of research at JPL? Do you work there or is it some sort of internship program?

I'm just going through as an undergrad currently. I don't work at JPL at all. I just approached her after her talk and started talking to her about Rosetta and possibly doing science with her as an intern next summer. I'm not sure if it would be through ossi but it could be. I don't really know what type of research it would be and neither does she. She just mentioned that we can talk about it and figure out something for me to do which is arguably even cooler! I need to email her and figure out the details and see what can actually happen. It was definitely my highlight of the conference though! I'm having techinical issues and getting pictures to my pc from my phone and I'm sick right now and I don't want to deal with it. It will come soonÃ¢â€žÂ¢

7.8 km from the surface, 66.5 cm/px at closest surfaces.

http://blogs.esa.int/rosetta/2014/10/20/cometwatch-18-october/

Neck of the comet, where the outgassing is the most powerful.

Some of these dots are probably particles orbiting the comet.
I read that 67P smells like ...., so what to do now, abandon mission and get Rosetta back to a better smelling Comet?
Getting quite excited about this. Assuming there is a live stream on the ESA website, I'm probably going to book the day off work to watch Philae do its thing.

Ha that's pretty funny.

I made one earlier with a football field to scale:

http://i.imgur.com/tAqhp1m.jpg

thats going to be a very interesting game.

I won't link such crap here because it's against the rules, but I just wanted you to know that the goblins in heads of conspiracy theorists have started to do their dance. Typical highly magnified, low resolution photos of the comet are now online, with "alien artifacts" being pointed out.

It's incredible. They're so predictable.
Come on, cut them some slack. This mission is to them what a trip to Disneyland is to a small child. They just can't contain their excitement

I just heard about this story on the evening news: Scientists Say Rosetta's Comet Stinks -- Literally

Whether you regard the story as an odious attempt at keeping Cherry-Gerry in the news or as a legitimate science story, it is kind of fun.

Yeah, but how big is Cherry- Jerry compared to the Death Star? Or a Blue Whale?

https://www.flickr.com/photos/geckzilla/15416177797/
Looked at that, didn't see death star. Scrolled down, no other pictures. Scrolled back up. Holy crap there it is.

Whether you regard the story as an odious attempt at keeping Cherry-Gerry in the news (...)

Didn't you mean... an odorous attempt?
